title: Classic Margherita Pizza
description: A traditional Italian pizza topped with tomato sauce, fresh mozzarella, basil, and olive oil.
steps: Preheat oven to 475°F (245°C).
Roll out the pizza dough on a floured surface.
Spread tomato sauce evenly over the dough.
Arrange mozzarella slices on top.
Bake for 10-12 minutes until crust is golden.
Remove from oven and top with fresh basil leaves.
Drizzle with olive oil, season with salt and pepper.

title: Chicken Alfredo Pasta
description: Creamy fettuccine pasta with grilled chicken and homemade Alfredo sauce.
steps: Cook pasta according to package instructions.
Season chicken with salt and pepper, then grill until cooked through. Slice into strips.
In a large skillet, heat olive oil and sauté garlic until fragrant.
Add heavy cream and bring to a simmer.
Stir in Parmesan cheese until melted and sauce thickens.
Add butter and stir until melted.
Toss cooked pasta in the sauce.
Add sliced chicken on top.
Garnish with fresh parsley and extra Parmesan if desired.

title: Vegetable Stir Fry
description: A quick and healthy stir fry with colorful vegetables and a savory sauce.
steps: Heat vegetable oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat.
Add onion and stir fry for 1 minute.
Add carrots and cook for 2 minutes.
Add bell peppers, broccoli, and snap peas. Stir fry for 3-4 minutes until vegetables are crisp-tender.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
In a small bowl, mix soy sauce, honey, and sesame oil. Pour over vegetables.
Toss to coat and cook for another minute.
Garnish with sesame seeds and serve over rice if desired.

title: Classic French Onion Soup
description: Rich, flavorful onion soup topped with crusty bread and melted Gruyère cheese.
steps: In a large pot, melt butter with olive oil over medium heat.
Add sliced onions and sugar, cook for 25-30 minutes, stirring occasionally until deeply caramelized.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute.
Sprinkle flour over onions and cook for 1-2 minutes.
Pour in wine and scrape up any browned bits from the pot.
Add beef broth, bay leaves, and thyme. Bring to a simmer.
Reduce heat and simmer for 25-30 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.
Preheat broiler. Ladle soup into oven-safe bowls.
Top each bowl with a slice of baguette and generous amount of Gruyère cheese.
Broil until cheese is melted and bubbly, about 2-3 minutes.

title: Guacamole
description: Fresh homemade guacamole with ripe avocados, lime, and cilantro.
steps: Halve and pit the avocados, then scoop into a bowl.
Mash avocados with a fork, leaving some chunks.
Add lime juice and stir to combine.
Mix in onion, tomatoes, cilantro, jalapeño, and garlic.
Season with salt and cumin.
Taste and adjust seasoning as needed.
Serve immediately with tortilla chips or refrigerate with plastic wrap pressed directly on the surface to prevent browning.

title: Chocolate Chip Cookies
description: Classic homemade chocolate chip cookies with a perfect chewy center and crisp edges.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
In a small bowl, mix flour, baking soda, and salt.
In a large bowl, cream together butter, granulated sugar, and brown sugar until fluffy.
Beat in eggs one at a time, then stir in vanilla.
Gradually blend in the dry ingredients.
Stir in chocolate chips and walnuts if using.
Drop by rounded tablespoons onto ungreased baking sheets.
Bake for 9-11 minutes or until golden brown.
Let stand on baking sheet for 2 minutes, then transfer to wire racks to cool completely.

title: chicken Tacos
description: Flavorful ground beef tacos with fresh toppings and homemade seasoning.
steps: In a large skillet, cook ground beef over medium-high heat until browned.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 1 minute more.
Stir in chili powder, cumin, paprika, oregano, cayenne pepper, and salt.
Add tomato sauce and simmer for 5 minutes.
Heat taco shells according to package directions.
Fill shells with beef mixture and top with lettuce, tomatoes, cheese, sour cream, and avocado.

title: Greek Salad
description: Fresh Mediterranean salad with cucumbers, tomatoes, olives, and feta cheese.
steps: In a large bowl, combine cucumber, tomatoes, red onion, bell pepper, and olives.
Add feta cheese and parsley.
In a small bowl, whisk together olive oil, red wine vinegar, oregano, salt, and pepper.
Pour dressing over salad and toss gently to combine.
Let sit for 10 minutes before serving to allow flavors to meld.

title: Mushroom Risotto
description: Creamy Italian rice dish with sautéed mushrooms and Parmesan cheese.
ingredients: 8 oz mushrooms, sliced (cremini, shiitake, or mixed)
steps: In a saucepan, bring broth to a simmer, then keep warm.
In a large, wide pan, heat olive oil over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and mushrooms, cook until mushrooms are tender, about 5 minutes.
Add Arborio rice and stir to coat with oil, cook for 1-2 minutes.
Pour in wine and stir until absorbed.
Begin adding warm broth, one ladle at a time, stirring frequently.
Wait until each addition is mostly absorbed before adding more broth.
Continue until rice is creamy and tender, about 20-25 minutes.
Remove from heat, stir in Parmesan cheese and butter.
Season with salt and pepper, garnish with parsley before serving.

title: Banana Bread
description: Moist and delicious banana bread with walnuts and a hint of cinnamon.
steps: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Grease a 4x8-inch loaf pan.
In a mixing bowl, mash the ripe bananas with a fork.
Stir in melted butter.
Mix in baking soda and salt.
Stir in sugar, beaten egg, and vanilla extract.
Mix in flour and cinnamon.
Fold in chopped walnuts if using.
Pour batter into prepared loaf pan.
Bake for 50-60 minutes or until a toothpick inserted comes out clean.
Let cool in the pan for 10 minutes, then remove and cool completely on a wire rack.

title: Lemon Garlic Salmon
description: Baked salmon fillets with a refreshing lemon garlic butter sauce.
steps: Preheat oven to 375°F (190°C).
Line a baking sheet with parchment paper or foil.
Place salmon fillets on the prepared baking sheet.
In a small bowl, mix melted butter, garlic, lemon juice, lemon zest, dill, and oregano.
Pour sauce over salmon fillets, ensuring they're well coated.
Season with salt and pepper.
Top with lemon slices.
Bake for 15-20 minutes, until salmon flakes easily with a fork.
Spoon pan juices over salmon before serving.

title: Vegetable Curry
description: Hearty vegetable curry with aromatic spices and coconut milk.
steps: Heat oil in a large pot over medium heat.
Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes.
Add garlic and ginger, cook for 1 minute until fragrant.
Stir in curry powder, cumin, coriander, turmeric, and cayenne pepper. Cook for 30 seconds.
Add diced tomatoes, coconut milk, and vegetable broth. Stir to combine.
Add carrots, potato, and cauliflower. Bring to a simmer.
Cover and cook for 15 minutes.
Add bell pepper and peas. Cook for another 5-7 minutes until all vegetables are tender.
Season with salt to taste.
Garnish with fresh cilantro and serve with rice or naan bread.

title: Beef Stroganoff
description: Classic Russian dish with tender beef strips in a creamy mushroom sauce.
steps: Season beef strips with salt and pepper.
Heat oil in a large skillet over high heat. Add beef in batches and cook until browned, about 1-2 minutes per side. Remove and set aside.
In the same skillet, add butter, onion, and mushrooms. Cook until softened, about 5-7 minutes.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds.
Sprinkle flour over the vegetables and stir to coat.
Gradually add beef broth, stirring constantly to prevent lumps.
Bring to a simmer and cook until sauce thickens, about 5 minutes.
Stir in Dijon mustard.
Reduce heat to low, add sour cream, and stir until combined. Do not boil.
Return beef to the skillet and heat through.
Garnish with parsley and serve over cooked egg noodles.

title: Apple Pie
description: Classic American apple pie with a flaky crust and cinnamon-spiced filling.
ingredients: 6-7 medium apples (Granny Smith or mixed varieties), peeled and sliced
2 tbsp unsalted butter, cut into small pieces
steps: For the crust: In a food processor, combine flour, salt, and sugar. Add butter and pulse until mixture resembles coarse meal.
Gradually add ice water, 1 tablespoon at a time, pulsing until dough begins to form a ball.
Divide dough in half, form into disks, wrap in plastic, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour.
Preheat oven to 425°F (220°C).
Roll out one disk of dough on a floured surface to fit a 9-inch pie plate. Transfer to pie plate.
For the filling: In a large bowl, combine sliced apples, sugar, flour, lemon juice, cinnamon, nutmeg, and salt.
Pour apple mixture into pie crust. Dot with butter pieces.
Roll out second disk of dough and place over filling. Trim, seal, and crimp edges. Cut slits in top crust for steam to escape.
Brush top with beaten egg and sprinkle with sugar.
Bake for 45-50 minutes, or until crust is golden brown and filling is bubbly.
Cool on a wire rack for at least 2 hours before serving.

title: Caesar Salad
description: Classic Caesar salad with romaine lettuce, croutons, Parmesan, and creamy dressing.
steps: For the dressing: In a bowl, whisk together mayonnaise, lemon juice, garlic, Worcestershire sauce, and Dijon mustard.
Stir in grated Parmesan cheese. Season with salt and pepper.
In a large bowl, toss romaine lettuce with enough dressing to coat.
Add croutons and toss gently.
Top with shaved Parmesan cheese and fresh ground black pepper.
Serve immediately.

title: Spaghetti Carbonara
description: Classic Italian pasta dish with eggs, cheese, pancetta, and black pepper.
ingredients: 1 cup freshly grated Pecorino Romano cheese
steps: Bring a large pot of salted water to boil. Cook spaghetti according to package directions until al dente.
While pasta cooks, heat olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add pancetta and cook until crispy, about 5-7 minutes.
Add minced garlic and cook for 30 seconds, being careful not to burn it.
In a bowl, whisk together eggs, Pecorino Romano, and Parmesan cheese.
Reserve 1 cup of pasta water, then drain pasta.
Working quickly, add hot pasta to the skillet with pancetta and garlic. Toss to combine.
Remove skillet from heat. Pour egg and cheese mixture over pasta, stirring continuously to create a creamy sauce. If too thick, add reserved pasta water a little at a time.
Season generously with freshly ground black pepper and salt to taste.
Garnish with chopped parsley and serve immediately.

title: Blueberry Pancakes
description: Fluffy homemade pancakes studded with fresh blueberries.
ingredients: Additional butter or oil for cooking
steps: In a large bowl, whisk together flour, sugar, baking powder, baking soda, and salt.
In another bowl, whisk together buttermilk, eggs, melted butter, and vanilla extract.
Pour wet ingredients into dry ingredients and stir until just combined. Some lumps are okay.
Gently fold in blueberries.
Heat a griddle or non-stick skillet over medium heat. Add a small amount of butter or oil.
Pour 1/4 cup of batter onto the griddle for each pancake.
Cook until bubbles form on the surface, about 2-3 minutes.
Flip and cook until the other side is golden brown, about 1-2 minutes more.
Serve warm with maple syrup.

title: Pad Thai
description: Classic Thai stir-fried noodle dish with a perfect balance of sweet, sour, and savory flavors.
ingredients: 8 oz chicken breast or tofu, sliced (optional)
3 tbsp fish sauce (or soy sauce for vegetarian)
steps: Soak rice noodles in hot water according to package directions until softened but still firm. Drain and set aside.
In a small bowl, whisk together sauce ingredients: fish sauce, brown sugar, tamarind paste, sriracha (if using), and lime juice.
Heat oil in a large wok or skillet over medium-high heat.
Add garlic and cook for 30 seconds until fragrant.
If using chicken or tofu, add now and cook until done, about 3-4 minutes.
Push ingredients to one side of the pan and pour beaten eggs into the empty side. Scramble until set, then mix with other ingredients.
Add drained noodles to the pan and pour sauce over them. Toss everything together.
Cook for 2-3 minutes, stirring frequently until noodles are tender and have absorbed the sauce.
Add bean sprouts and half the green onions. Toss for another minute.
Remove from heat and garnish with remaining green onions, chopped peanuts, and cilantro.
Serve with lime wedges on the side.
